intro: Fadogia verdcourtii var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy fadogia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, hairy stipules, and its flowers are typically white or pale pink with a distinctive calyx. It grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its rarity and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
